title: California launched the first solar canal panel — here’s why that’s a big win
content:
Mounting evidence suggests the western United States is now in its worst megadrought in at least 1,200 years. Groundwater supplies are being overpumped in many places, and the dryness, wildfires and shrinking water supplies are making climate change personal for millions of people. As an engineer, I have been working with colleagues on a way to both protect water supplies and boost renewable energy to protect the climate. We call it the solar-canal solution, and it’s about to be tested in California. About 4,000 miles of canals transport water to some 35 million Californians and 5.7 million acres of farmland…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: The first prototypes in the U.S. for both wide-span and narrow-span canals are now in development in California’s Central Valley.
